intro: Hemitelia ameristoneura, commonly known as the narrow-veined hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate with prominent, parallel veins, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Hemitelia ameristoneura is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
